hints.content:
First, let's find the number of cheese and sausage pizzas sold.


[[☃ image 1]]

Topping | Number of Pizzas
- | - | -
$\blueD{\text{Cheese}}$ | $75$ pizzas
$\purpleD{\text{Sausage}}$ | $40$ pizzas
$\goldE{\text{Mushroom}}$ | $?$

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Pizzas Sold and the vertical axis labeled Topping. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, and 80. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: sausage, pepperoni, cheese, and mushroom. The bar line for each type of topping shows the following: sausage bar line extends to 40, pepperoni bar line extends to the middle of 50 and 60, cheese bar line extends to the middle of 70 and 80, and mushroom bar line is labeled with a question mark. A purple line labeled 40 is drawn up from 40, which reaches to the end of sausage bar line. A blue line is drawn up from between 70 and 80, which reaches to the end of cheese bar line labeled 75 !

hints.content:
Now, let's find the number of mushroom pizzas sold.

The value is the same as the difference between the number of cheese and sausage pizzas sold, so we need to subtract.

$\begin{align}
\blueD{\text{Cheese}} - \purpleD{\text{Sausage}} &= \goldE{\text{Mushroom}}\\\\
\blueD{75} - \purpleD{40} &={} \goldE{?}\\\\
\goldE{\text{Mushroom}}&=\goldE{35}
\end{align}$

question.content:

The number of mushroom pizzas sold is the same as the difference between the number of cheese pizzas sold and sausage pizzas sold.
